CHAT.comment: MOT and Chi play well together. Chi dominates the entire time during the activity. EXP stays in the background for the most part. Chi is considerably enthusiastic throughout the activity. She often engages in fantasy play. Chi also spends time experimenting with various objects to see which ones stick. Her theory is that metal objects stick. Although she is proved wrong when she tests two pairs of metal earrings , she does not revise her theory.
video does not start until later; transcription until then is solely from audio

MOT and Chi sit at a table with the objects in between them; Chi is stacking silver men on the black base

a man falls from the top of the tower
pushes the tower of three silver men down onto another lone silver man who stands on the base
removes the yellow wand from the side of the black base

picks up the turtle to look at it more closely
swings the yellow wand around as if it were a magic wand and then taps the silver man tower which Mot has rebuilt
touches the yellow wand to the silver man tower and then removes the wand; the tower remains standing
brings the wand close to the silver man tower , then pulls the wand quickly away; this time the tower falls onto the black base
sets two of the silver men upright and places a third silver man on top in the shape of an inverted triangle
Chi holds the yellow wand; two silver men lie flat on the wand; one of the silver men appears to be holding a ball in each of his hands
picks up the plastic sheep to study it more closely
touches the sheep to the yellow wand
knocks over a silver man on the black base using the white sheep
